text: Loch Dionard is a loch in Sutherland in the Highland Council Area in northern Scotland.https://getoutside.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/local/loch-dionard-highland More direct link to Get Outside It is in the North-Western Highlands four miles south of Polla. == Etymology == The name may be from dyn-fjordr, 'noisy-firth.'https://www.jstor.org/stable/30069878 | Some Sutherland Names of Places. W. J. Watson, The Celtic Review, Vol. 2, No. 8 (Apr., 1906), pp. 360-368. == History == The first mentions of Loch Dionard were in the late 16th or early 17th Century with the Loch being mapped and named as Dynard. == References == Category:Lochs
title: Loch Dionard
